page.title: 13Life in Lavenham
page.content: In Lavenham many houses,which used to be derelict,have been repaired.Shopping facilities are adequate,though many people would like a wet fish shop in the village.A number of people shop in nearby market towns,for which a car is essential as there is little public transport.There are several buses out of the village,but few return.The biggest factory runs its own buses for its workforce.Many feel concerned about the amount of traffic using the village streets,especially heavy lorries on their way to nearby ports.Concern has also been expressed about parking in the streets,particularly of tourist coaches,and it is felt extra car parks should be built on the edge of the village.Tourism is welcomed for the trade it brings;several gift shops have been established to cater for tourist's needs.
